individual_metadata.synopsis: Dialogue with Nere after you fought the duergar with him and he sent you away either to find help in Moonrise or simply to leave him alone. His cold malice and zealotry should shine through.

Mindmeld.synopsis: A mindmeld with a True Soul through a brick wall - the connection is unstable because of this, and we do not hear everything the True Soul says.
Mindmeld.how_to_trigger: 1. Start the game. 2. goto -629 3193. Click on the rubble.

Dead.synopsis: Speak with Dead dialogue for True Soul Nere. He may tell you about the temple he was looking for as well as what is inside it.

FollowUp.synopsis: After fighting and killing a group of duergar servants that mutinied against him, Nere takes his rage and frustration out on one of their bodies by kicking it. Once he's done, he takes the players to a nearby broken bridge and explains that he needs reinforcements. The player can promise they'll inform his boss - Chosen Ketheric - or not.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.synopsis: When trying to leave Grymforge before freeing Nere, you get a mindmeld from Nere, warning that he will die if you leave. Nere is not physically present in scene - only his voice is heard.

Mutiny.synopsis: Dialogue after you destroy the cave-in and set Nere free. Thrinn has been put in charge of getting Nere out, but it's the player who accomplishes it. Nere almost just died from inhaling poisonous gas, so he's very angry. In this dialogue, you determine the fate of the gnomes as well as Nere and the mutinous duergar.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Analyzing the session synopses shows that the events can follow different branches. In one branch, after fighting the duergar with Nere, he sends you away (the session with an empty key), and if you try leaving Grymforge before freeing him you get the 'Mindmeld_LeavingRegion' warning. In the alternative branch you can instead free Nere by destroying the cave‐in – this triggers the 'Mutiny' dialogue (where Nere is nearly asphyxiated and angered) and then later a follow‐up conversation ('FollowUp') occurs in which he details his need for reinforcements. Finally, there is a separate dialogue ('Dead') that is spoken with Dead True Soul Nere – a branch that implies Nere has died. Clearly only one of these branches may occur in a single playthrough. In addition, within the “free him” branch the ordering is clear: you must first complete the events that free Nere (triggering 'Mutiny') and then the dialogue that follows ('FollowUp').

0.speaker: Nere
0.text: Didn't I tell you to go to Moonrise Towers? The General must be told of my situation.

1.speaker: Nere
1.text: Leave me be. You've done enough.

2.speaker: Nere
2.text: Why are you still here? Go!

Mindmeld_10.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_10.text: *You make out only a few faint figures and scattered debris through Nere's eyes.*

Mindmeld_11.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_11.text: *As you near the rubble, a fragmented voice clutches at your mind.*
Mindmeld_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere starting to Mindmeld with the player

Mindmeld_24.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_24.context: NodeContext: The original line is 'A True Soul? This is Nere. Tell those Imbiciles to hurry up! I am choking on poison.' Should be recorded normally, and effects should be added later to make it sound like the voice is fading in and out.

Mindmeld_12.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_12.text: Finally! You must clear... rubble. Filling... poison!

Mindmeld_9.speaker: Player
Mindmeld_9.text: Are you Nere? What happened here?

Mindmeld_20.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_20.text: Expedition... passage trapped. Gnomes... Useless. Don't trust... mercs...

Mindmeld_15.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_15.text: Gnome slaves... passage trapped. Careful of... mercs...

Mindmeld_1.speaker: Player
Mindmeld_1.text: Stay still. I'll do what I can.

Mindmeld_4.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_4.text: ...it quick or... head! Careful... mercs... on the edge...

Mindmeld_18.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_18.text: *The view through Nere's eyes is a blur. You only make out a bit of rubble and few moving figures.*
Mindmeld_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: View from Nere's persepective Vision blurred and

Mindmeld_19.speaker: Player
Mindmeld_19.text: Try to focus. What more can you see?

Mindmeld_16.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_16.text: *The blur resolves into an image. Two gnomes feverishly removing debris...*

Mindmeld_22.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_22.text: *...while two others lie dead at Nere's feet, their flesh scorched by powerful magic.*
Mindmeld_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bodies of 2 gnomes among the rubble

Mindmeld_2.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_2.text: *The harder you look, the fuzzier the images become, until there is only grey.*
Mindmeld_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Image blurs before greying out/fading to black

Mindmeld_3.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_3.text: *You sense Nere's frustration, tinged with rage, as the connection fades.*

Dead_6.speaker: Narrator
Dead_6.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Dead_2.speaker: Nere
Dead_2.text: Find... path to temple... orders of General...

Dead_23.speaker: Player
Dead_23.text: What about this temple is so important?

Dead_14.speaker: Player
Dead_14.text: Tell me more about this General.

Dead_1.speaker: Player
Dead_1.text: How can I get to Moonrise Towers?

Dead_9.speaker: Nere
Dead_9.context: NodeContext: The tunnel has all kinds of ominous sounds coming out of it so Nere can't be sure it's safe.

Dead_21.speaker: Player
Dead_21.text: Did you come here with the duergar?

Dead_13.speaker: Narrator
Dead_13.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

FollowUp_22.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the duergar corpsesInternalNodeContext: Note: speaking of the duergar

FollowUp_89.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_89.text: You don't deserve the death you got. I should have made it last.
FollowUp_89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the duergar corpses

FollowUp_34.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_34.text: As for the rest of you slave-worms - you've caused enough trouble.
FollowUp_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere rears back to cast a spell at the remaining gnomes

FollowUp_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere fires the spell and the gnomes are dead.

FollowUp_46.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_46.text: This was meant to be a simple operation - I arrive, those pack animals clear the debris, and I walk into the temple.

FollowUp_108.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_108.text: Instead, I've been beset by incompetence, treachery, and now this. The Absolute's business remains unfinished.
FollowUp_108.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'this' he gestures to the broken bridge in front of him.

FollowUp_95.speaker: Player
FollowUp_95.text: Unfortunate - but how does this concern me?

FollowUp_82.speaker: Player
FollowUp_82.text: And what business is that, exactly?

FollowUp_32.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_32.text: Important business. My orders come from General Thorm himself.

FollowUp_112.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_112.text: I need you to deliver a message to him. Tell the General that I did what I could, but that the route through Grymforge is impassable.

FollowUp_56.speaker: Player
FollowUp_56.text: First tell me what happened to this place.

FollowUp_4.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_4.text: When the General entrusted me with this mission, he warned there may be some damage caused by a monster let loose in the temple.

FollowUp_63.speaker: Player
FollowUp_63.text: The General? Is he a favourite of the Absolute?

FollowUp_8.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_8.text: The favourite. Nothing is done in these lands without his knowledge.

FollowUp_38.speaker: Player
FollowUp_38.text: I'll do it. Where can I find the General?

FollowUp_3.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_3.text: The General resides at Moonrise Towers, but you cannot simply travel there. The land surrounding the Towers is blighted by a deadly curse.

FollowUp_113.speaker: Player
FollowUp_113.text: If you survived, I'm sure I will.

FollowUp_37.speaker: Player
FollowUp_37.text: If that's the case, how do I reach it safely?

FollowUp_50.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_50.text: I had a Moonlantern to keep the curse at bay. Alas, the rocks did it in.
FollowUp_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pulls out a broken moonlantern to show you

FollowUp_28.speaker: Lae'zel
FollowUp_28.text: Broken. We meddled in these paltry affairs, and for what?

FollowUp_62.speaker: Shadowheart
FollowUp_62.text: Damn it. So much for using that thing to protect us.
FollowUp_62.context: NodeContext: Exasperated. Some special equipment the party went out of their way to retrieve is broken beyond repair.

FollowUp_25.speaker: Karlach
FollowUp_25.text: It's broken?! Argh, you've got to be kidding!

FollowUp_0.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_0.text: Calm yourself - we have allies on the surface. Seek them out, and play this lyre to call on their guide.
FollowUp_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: stows the moon lantern back where he kept it

FollowUp_84.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_84.text: Whatever you do - do not attempt the journey to Moonrise without his protection. I promise you, it will not end well.

FollowUp_13.speaker: Player
FollowUp_13.text: Minthara already offered to help me.

FollowUp_65.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_65.text: Minthara? I'm surprised she hasn't got herself killed on one of her reckless raids.

FollowUp_77.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_77.text: You would be wiser to align yourself with me than her. Few earn the General's favour - I am sure to be among them.

FollowUp_92.speaker: Player
FollowUp_92.text: All right, I'll tell the General what happened here.

FollowUp_69.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_69.text: Do not tarry. I will see you again, but only when my work is done.

FollowUp_16.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_16.text: I can still reach the temple and fulfil the General's orders. His advisor, Balthazar, also sought a way.

FollowUp_71.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_71.text: I'll pick up his trail and follow him. Prove myself his superior.

FollowUp_18.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_18.text: I am generous to those who aid him. When I return to Moonrise, I will be triumphant, and you will share in my victory.

FollowUp_51.speaker: Player
FollowUp_51.text: I'd rather make my own way than rely on your help.

FollowUp_107.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_107.text: You insolent worm. You would refuse Nere? Refuse the Absolute?

FollowUp_115.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_115.text: If you won't help me, I may as well enjoy this.

FollowUp_100.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_100.text: The Absolute should be demanding I take your head for insolence like that, but I can't hear Her voice.

FollowUp_31.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_31.text: What's going on? What have you done?

FollowUp_78.speaker: Player
FollowUp_78.text: What are you talking about? I can hear Her just fine.

FollowUp_6.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_6.text: I - never mind. Go to the General at Moonrise. There's little time to waste.

FollowUp_2.speaker: Player
FollowUp_2.text: Explain that the Absolute is a front for mind flayers - you're protected from them.

FollowUp_11.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_11.text: Impossible. I should slit your throat for speaking such blasphemy.

FollowUp_106.speaker: Player
FollowUp_106.text: Forget it. I was merely testing your faith.

FollowUp_7.speaker: Player
FollowUp_7.text: It's true - it's a shadowy conspiracy headed by mind flayers and... tax collectors.

FollowUp_88.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_88.text: I - I don't understand. I've been following those wretched beasts?

FollowUp_23.speaker: Player
FollowUp_23.text: Your faith in Lolth faltered. It is not too late to reclaim it.

FollowUp_60.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_60.text: Was I so weak as to betray the Weaver?

FollowUp_73.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_73.text: I will take word to the Order of Soul Spiders. They must know of the Absolute threat.

FollowUp_41.speaker: Player
FollowUp_41.text: Your faith in Lolth faltered. It is not too late to reclaim it.

FollowUp_24.speaker: Player
FollowUp_24.text: Yes, I bet you're feeling pretty stupid right now, aren't you?

FollowUp_35.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_35.text: No. You have a trick - an enchantment. If it can protect you, it'll protect me. All I have to do is take it.
FollowUp_35.context: NodeContext: You're about to attack the player

FollowUp_14.speaker: Player
FollowUp_14.text: You don't have to. Run - abandon the Absolute.

FollowUp_17.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_17.text: Perhaps you're right. Perhaps I should.

FollowUp_98.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_98.text: Abandon the Absolute? After everything I've done for Her? Everything She's done for me?

FollowUp_9.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_9.text: No, it's not true - you're here to test my faith. And I will not fail.
FollowUp_9.context: NodeContext: Last sentence grim and determined - about to attack

FollowUp_103.speaker: Player
FollowUp_103.text: People have followed cults for a long time. You're just another victim.

FollowUp_81.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_81.text: You're right. I'm a fool for not seeing it before now.
FollowUp_81.context: NodeContext: Ashamed but mostly angry that he was deceived

FollowUp_12.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_12.text: Dying for a cause is one thing, but for a mind flayer? For filth like that? No.

FollowUp_70.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_70.text: I owe you a debt. And I would hate to be ungrateful.

FollowUp_44.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_44.text: Take this - a personal blessing. I pray we don't meet again.
FollowUp_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Generic item hand-off below camera - item TBD

FollowUp_110.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_110.text: I owe you a debt, it seems. You've saved me from worse than the duergar.

FollowUp_49.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_49.text: The Absolute is no mere cult - it is a calling. And you are here to test my faith.
FollowUp_49.context: NodeContext: Last sentence grim and determined - about to attack

FollowUp_42.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_42.text: It cannot be. Have I betrayed Lolth for an impostor?

FollowUp_76.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_76.text: Fool. My mind is not your playground.

FollowUp_27.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_27.text: You expect me to believe such madness?

FollowUp_5.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_5.text: I will tear your heart from your chest. And I will hear Her voice again.

FollowUp_10.speaker: Player
FollowUp_10.text: I was abducted by mind flayers. That was when I began to hear the Absolute.

FollowUp_75.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_75.text: Liar. I've seen no such creatures.

FollowUp_39.speaker: Player
FollowUp_39.text: I haven't done anything, but I don't hear Her either.

FollowUp_36.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_36.text: It's you, it must be. You've done something to anger Her.

FollowUp_21.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_21.text: Whatever it is, I'll set it right. I'll cut you down in Her name!

FollowUp_30.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_30.text: There is another way, though - we have allies on the surface. Seek them out, and play this lyre to call on their guide.
FollowUp_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: stows the moon lantern back where he kept it

FollowUp_94.speaker: Astarion
FollowUp_94.text: Of course they did. Why would anything go our way?
FollowUp_94.context: NodeContext: Annnoyed at yet another setback.

FollowUp_33.speaker: Wyll
FollowUp_33.text: The Moonlantern's broken? Just our luck.

FollowUp_86.speaker: Gale
FollowUp_86.text: A broken Moonlantern? They say that's ten years of bad luck.

FollowUp_15.speaker: Player
FollowUp_15.text: I'm not risking a curse for you, the General, or anyone else.

FollowUp_26.speaker: Player
FollowUp_26.text: You can report your own failures.

FollowUp_72.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_72.text: This is not a failure, it's only a setback. I have been entrusted with a sacred mission - I cannot fail.

FollowUp_59.speaker: Player
FollowUp_59.text: Whoever sent you isn't going to be very happy.

FollowUp_20.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_20.text: No - the General will understand that none of this was my fault. He will understand, because you will tell him.
FollowUp_20.context: NodeContext: Uncertain that the General will understand

FollowUp_111.speaker: Player
FollowUp_111.text: Enter Nere's mind. 'The gnomes must be set free.'

FollowUp_29.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_29.text: I... yes. It will be so.
FollowUp_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere reacts to a brief mindmeld while maintaining the spell at the ready, then regains his composure

FollowUp_67.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_67.text: Gnomes, you are slaves no longer. The Absolute may have use for you yet.
FollowUp_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere lowers his arm and enters default speaking position. Addressed to remaining gnomes

FollowUp_93.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_93.text: I don't know what you are, that you can defy the Absolute's will.
FollowUp_93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere reacts to a brief mindmeld while maintaining the spell at the ready, then frowns at the player before delivering his line

FollowUp_61.speaker: Nere
FollowUp_61.text: But I know you are a traitor - and I will show no mercy!

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_0.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_0.text: *A faint voice echoes in your mind.*
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld: Nere is calling out to player from a distance

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_1.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_1.text: I sense you, True Soul... come to me, come to Nere... the poison spreads.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_1.context: NodeContext: Voice goes in and out, as if the connection is weak

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_4.speaker: Lae'zel
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_4.text: Chk. The trapped drow will die if we leave. Forgive me if I have no tears to shed.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_7.speaker: Shadowheart
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_7.text: Nere's as good as dead without us... let's just hope his whispers don't reach any True Souls.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_3.speaker: Karlach
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_3.text: Did you hear that? The poor evil cultist needs our help.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_11.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_11.text: *Nere's voice fades, but your head still tingles with his anger... and fear.*

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_10.speaker: Astarion
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_10.text: Hear that? Our friend Nere won't last long. Pity.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_10.context: NodeContext: Slightly amused - Astarion's feeling pretty pleased about this drow dying.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_5.speaker: Wyll
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_5.text: Hells - Nere'll die if we leave. What becomes of the slaves then?

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_9.speaker: Wyll
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_9.text: Nere'll die if we leave. Is that a chance you want to take?

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_8.speaker: Gale
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion_8.text: You hear him too, don't you? Nere is not long for this world unless we get him out of there.

Mutiny_176.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_176.context: NodeContext: Said with great relief, but tinged with anger

Mutiny_44.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_44.text: Worthless slaves. Your incompetence has been my ruin.
Mutiny_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the gnomesNodeContext: Intense but quietly so.

Mutiny_104.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_104.context: CinematicNodeContext: True Soul Nere prepares his spell, readying to attack the gnome Meerna. Nere strikes Meerna down with a magic attack, and raises his hand to strike down Beldron.NodeContext: ZHIL loo-NIN! Rising, seething anger. Only the last word should be louder.

Mutiny_184.speaker: Player
Mutiny_184.text: Stop! No more innocents will die today, Nere.

Mutiny_216.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_216.text: So you care for the weak, True Soul. Was it your hand that slayed Nere's servants? Or is there a sane explanation?

Mutiny_34.speaker: Narrator
Mutiny_34.text: *Nere sifts through your memories - and a new presence clouds your mind. The duergar elder.*
Mutiny_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: You, Nere, and Brithvar grip your heads in a mindmeld. Nere senses Brithvar through you.

Mutiny_139.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_139.text: You care for the weak, True Soul. Most curious.

Mutiny_0.speaker: Player
Mutiny_0.text: I came on the myconid sovereign's behalf. It demands revenge.

Mutiny_106.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_106.text: You heed an overgrown toadstool, yet defy a True Soul?

Mutiny_97.speaker: Player
Mutiny_97.text: I act on orders of the Absolute.

Mutiny_57.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_57.text: So you say. And yet the Absolute demands that I cull them.

Mutiny_8.speaker: Player
Mutiny_8.text: Of course I care. I can't let these gnomes suffer.

Mutiny_152.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_152.text: The Absolute demands their slaughter. Yet here you stand, in bold defiance.

Mutiny_98.speaker: Player
Mutiny_98.text: This isn't about them. I just can't stand your face.

Mutiny_140.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_140.text: And yet you came to my aid.

Mutiny_59.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_59.text: A test - yes, you must be. The Absolute bade you to try Nere's faith.

Mutiny_157.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_157.text: I will tear out your heart and feed it to the rats.

Mutiny_31.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_31.text: Thrinn. Carve out their heart and serve it to the rothé.

Mutiny_62.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_62.text: If they are indeed a True Soul, let the Absolute save them.

Mutiny_81.speaker: Player
Mutiny_81.text: You wouldn't dare. I'm faithful to the Absolute.

Mutiny_189.speaker: Narrator
Mutiny_189.text: *Your scalp buzzes as Nere's mind reaches out - not to you, but to the nearby duergar.*
Mutiny_189.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere holds his hand to his head as he mentally scans the room.

Mutiny_125.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_125.text: Ah - I see treachery at every turn. Not every duergar proves faithful to the Absolute.

Mutiny_128.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_128.text: Nere is not without mercy, True Soul. These overgrown rats have given you a chance to earn my favour.

Mutiny_60.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_60.text: Strike them down. Prove your faith.

Mutiny_71.speaker: Player
Mutiny_71.text: Side with Nere and the Absolutists.

Mutiny_123.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutiny_123.text: Shut your shitholes, both of yeh. You owe my crew a tenday's worth o' coin, Nere - and it's time you shell out.
Mutiny_123.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar pulls out his dagger and points it at Nere.

Mutiny_132.speaker: Narrator
Mutiny_132.text: *The elder's disgust grips your head like a vice - yet he remains silent.*
Mutiny_132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar mindmelds with the player and gives them the side eye.

Mutiny_174.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_174.text: Ah - another treacherous soul walks among us. Isn't that right, Brithvar?

Mutiny_6.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutiny_6.text: You been a shit since I laid eyes on you, red-eye. Go on, try and gut me. I ain't going down easy.
Mutiny_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Nere. Brithvar pulls out a dagger and points it at Nere.

Mutiny_108.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_108.text: Direct your blade at the heretic, duergar. You shall have your coin.

Mutiny_64.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutiny_64.text: You're damned right I'll have it. Me and that one, we got a deal. We beat your arse and dig the dues out from your carcass.
Mutiny_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Nere. Nod to player when saying 'that one'.

Mutiny_13.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_13.text: You bargained with this wretch? How vexing.

Mutiny_55.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_55.text: Nere is not without mercy, True Soul. The rat has given you a chance to earn my favour.

Mutiny_145.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_145.text: Strike him down. Prove your faith.

Mutiny_18.speaker: Player
Mutiny_18.text: Side with Brithvar and the rebels.

Mutiny_79.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutiny_79.text: Damn right I'll have it - straight off your rotted corpse.

Mutiny_158.speaker: Player
Mutiny_158.text: That's your cue, Brithvar. It's time you got paid.

Mutiny_76.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutiny_76.text: Damn right it's time. You owe my crew a tenday's worth o' coin, Nere - and the reckoning's come.
Mutiny_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar pulls out his dagger and points it at Nere.

Mutiny_33.speaker: Player
Mutiny_33.text: You so much as touch me, and I'll tear you from limb to limb.

Mutiny_19.speaker: Player
Mutiny_19.text: This battle will make a good story. Come, then.

Mutiny_148.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_148.text: The Absolute guides my hand. You've chosen a battle you cannot win.

Mutiny_39.speaker: Player
Mutiny_39.text: Try it. I'll cut you all down.

Mutiny_2.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_2.text: I see your idiocy is only surpassed by your ego.

Mutiny_214.speaker: Player
Mutiny_214.text: I'll slit your throats before you can blink.

Mutiny_69.speaker: Player
Mutiny_69.text: In your eulogy, I'm going to call you a 'Twat-Soul'.

Mutiny_3.speaker: Player
Mutiny_3.text: You command with the gravitas of a spoiled child. Pathetic.

Mutiny_115.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_115.text: Insufferable, insolent, scum. I'm going to enjoy this.

Mutiny_172.speaker: Player
Mutiny_172.text: I'll offer up your guts, ingrates.

Mutiny_111.speaker: Player
Mutiny_111.text: Your god. My oath. Let us see which prevails.

Mutiny_20.speaker: Player
Mutiny_20.text: The only weakness I see here is you.

Mutiny_22.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_22.text: You dare speak to me without due reverence? That was your first and last mistake.

Mutiny_109.speaker: Player
Mutiny_109.text: Says the idiot who got himself buried. Look at the stone - it was clearly a trap.

Mutiny_12.speaker: Player
Mutiny_12.text: If you'd listened to those gnomes, maybe you wouldn't have been trapped.

Mutiny_212.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_212.text: Ah, so you didn't come to my aid. You came to theirs.
Mutiny_212.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at Beldron with disgust

Mutiny_149.speaker: Player
Mutiny_149.text: You were left helpless by some rubble. You're hardly in a position to call anyone weak.

Mutiny_26.speaker: Player
Mutiny_26.text: And yet I don't care a jot for you. Now that's curious.

Mutiny_50.speaker: Player
Mutiny_50.text: I only see weakness in the cowardly slaver standing before me.

Mutiny_36.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_36.text: Yet the Absolute saw fit to bless you? I don't understand...

Mutiny_194.speaker: Player
Mutiny_194.text: My cares are none of your concern.

Mutiny_136.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_136.text: You're clearly a fool. Yet you saw fit to aid me?

Mutiny_99.speaker: Player
Mutiny_99.text: You would question me, drow? I should slit your throat for it.

Mutiny_198.speaker: Player
Mutiny_198.text: And you waste your time persecuting them. That is true weakness.

Mutiny_4.speaker: Player
Mutiny_4.text: Finish the slaves, True Soul. For the Absolute.

Mutiny_105.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_105.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere prepares to cast his spellNodeContext: ZHIL loo-NIN!

Mutiny_122.speaker: Lunkbug
Mutiny_122.context: NodeContext: Calling out in fear: his beloved is about to be executed

Mutiny_177.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere fires off a spell, killing Beldron, and then the remaining gnomes.

Mutiny_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere fires off a spell, killing Beldron, and then the remaining gnomes.

Mutiny_209.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_209.text: What is this, then? The Absolute's servants. Dead...

Mutiny_14.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_14.text: ... yet a True Soul still lives. I am sure there's a sane explanation.

Mutiny_15.speaker: Player
Mutiny_15.text: Those duergar were thorns in our sides, so I removed them.

Mutiny_27.speaker: Player
Mutiny_27.text: The myconid sovereign wants the rot cleansed - and you're last on the list.

Mutiny_96.speaker: Player
Mutiny_96.text: I killed your friends - and you're next.

Mutiny_37.speaker: Player
Mutiny_37.text: A slave uprising. They slaughtered every last one of their masters.

Mutiny_120.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_120.text: Vermin to the last. I might have guessed.

Mutiny_165.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_165.text: Vermin. As feral as they are useless.

Mutiny_70.speaker: Narrator
Mutiny_70.text: *A fire blazes in your head, then spreads through your blood.*
Mutiny_70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere's eyes widen. He is on to your lie.

Mutiny_178.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_178.text: You are a liar - and a fool. Nere suffers neither!

Mutiny_45.speaker: Player
Mutiny_45.text: The slavers turned on each other - mutineers versus Absolute loyalists.

Mutiny_196.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_196.text: Tensions were high - I am hardly surprised. The novices were lost without me to guide them.

Mutiny_202.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_202.text: You've a chance yet to prove your faith. Kill the slaves. Let Nere see them suffer.

Mutiny_169.speaker: Player
Mutiny_169.text: You're the only one suffering today, Nere.

Mutiny_73.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_73.text: Traitor. You have breathed your last!

Mutiny_183.speaker: Player
Mutiny_183.text: Plant a thought in Nere's mind. 'The gnomes must be set free.'

Mutiny_192.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_192.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it.

Mutiny_200.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_200.text: Gnomes, you are slaves no longer. The Absolute may have use for you yet.
Mutiny_200.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the gnome slaves.

Mutiny_61.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_61.text: As for you, our charge is clear - there is more we must do.

Mutiny_175.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_175.text: I don't know what you are, that you can defy the Absolute's will.
Mutiny_175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere grips his head in a brief mind-meld, then releases it and frowns at player.

Mutiny_162.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_162.text: But you are a traitor. And I will have your head!

Mutiny_40.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_40.text: The outsider did me a favour. The duergar were trouble from the start.

Mutiny_134.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_134.text: Fool. Did you think I wouldn't notice your intrusion?

Mutiny_204.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_204.text: Nere is your death. The Absolute wills it!

Mutiny_52.speaker: Narrator
Mutiny_52.text: *Your head tingles as Nere scans the room.*
Mutiny_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere holds his hand to his head as he mentally scans the room.

Mutiny_29.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_29.text: ... yet the faithless yet stand. Isn't that right, Brithvar?

Mutiny_159.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_159.text: Thrinn. The Absolute gave you everything. And this fiasco is how you reward Her?

Mutiny_179.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
Mutiny_179.text: Me and mine worked flat out. I was cracking the whip day and night! Tell him, True Soul!

Mutiny_133.speaker: Player
Mutiny_133.text: You were lazy, Thrinn. Without me, Nere would be dead.

Mutiny_153.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
Mutiny_153.text: No - no! I did everything right!

Mutiny_28.speaker: Player
Mutiny_28.text: It's true - you did your best.

Mutiny_210.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_210.text: Your best was not good enough.

Mutiny_83.speaker: Player
Mutiny_83.text: I don't care about your squabble. I just want Nere's head.

Mutiny_150.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_150.text: My head? I walk among traitors.

Mutiny_95.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_95.text: Nere pities you, Thrinn. Your errors and excuses. And your sorry end.
Mutiny_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Thrinn. Nere casts one final spell and Thrinn falls over dead.

Mutiny_113.speaker: Narrator
Mutiny_113.text: *Your skull buzzes, and you see your own face through Nere's eyes.*

Mutiny_25.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_25.text: ... you've one final chance to prove your allegiance.

Mutiny_185.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_185.text: Cut down the duergar - every last one. The Absolute commands it!

Mutiny_102.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_102.text: Worthless, every last one. Their failures must be punished.

Mutiny_7.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_7.text: True Soul - take their heads. The Absolute commands it!

Mutiny_118.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_118.text: Show them no mercy. Their corpses will make a fine offering to our mistress!

Mutiny_181.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_181.text: Duergar - this True Soul has betrayed us. Let their blood prove your devotion!

Mutiny_43.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutiny_43.text: If it means getting paid, my blade's yours!

Mutiny_197.speaker: Player
Mutiny_197.text: The only head I mean to take is yours, Nere.

Mutiny_23.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutiny_23.text: Bloody hells, had enough of your shit.
Mutiny_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Nere. Pulls out dagger and points it at Nere.

Mutiny_215.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutiny_215.text: You come turnin' my people, strikin' Thrinn dead - and you still ain't paid up. Shell it out, ya prickhole!

Mutiny_103.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_103.text: Drop the blade, duergar. You shall have your coin.

Mutiny_41.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_41.text: True Soul - prove your faith. Strike him down.

Mutiny_11.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_11.text: Heretics. Let Nere be your end.
Mutiny_11.context: NodeContext: Drugh = FUCK. DROOG (like food, not hood)

Mutiny_82.speaker: Player
Mutiny_82.text: Attack Brithvar and the duergar rebels.

Mutiny_66.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutiny_66.text: Damn it. I'll rip your flesh clean off!

Mutiny_116.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_116.text: Fool. Your silence speaks to your heresy. For the Absolute!

Mutiny_88.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_88.text: Brithvar. Did you think you could keep your plot a secret?

Mutiny_114.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutiny_114.text: You been a shit since I laid eyes on you, red-eye. Go on, try and gut me. I ain't going down easy.

Mutiny_35.speaker: Narrator
Mutiny_35.text: *Your scalp buzzes as Nere's mind reaches out - not to you, but to the duergar elder.*
Mutiny_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere and Brithvar experience a mindmeld.

Mutiny_147.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutiny_147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Nere. Pulls out dagger and points it at Nere.

Mutiny_75.speaker: Player
Mutiny_75.text: Try winning the argument by yourself, why don't you. It'll build character.

Mutiny_180.speaker: Player
Mutiny_180.text: Hmm? What? Sorry, I wasn't paying attention.

Mutiny_206.speaker: Player
Mutiny_206.text: You were needlessly cruel, Thrinn. You must pay the price.

Mutiny_203.speaker: Player
Mutiny_203.text: Your incompetence speaks for itself, duergar.

Mutiny_190.speaker: Nere
Mutiny_190.text: True Soul. Was it your hand that slayed Thrinn? No, of course not. There must be a sane explanation.

Mutiny_143.speaker: Player
Mutiny_143.text: Touch another innocent and I'll take your head, Nere.
